alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 9:10AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. For the Merced River...including Happy Isles, Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 10.3 feet late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/09/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM PDT.
